data.title: Thousands gather for funeral of ex Romanian poet
data.meta_description: BUCHAREST, Romania —  Thousands of Romanians have gathered for the funeral of poet Adrian Paunescu whose poetry struck a chord despite odes he wrote to late Communist dictator Nicolae Ceausescu. Paunescu died Friday of multiple organ failure aged 67, and the nation immediately went into mourning for the larger-than-life poet. One newspaper devoted its entire Saturday […]
data.text:
BUCHAREST, Romania — Thousands of Romanians have gathered for the funeral of poet Adrian Paunescu whose poetry struck a chord despite odes he wrote to late Communist dictator Nicolae Ceausescu.

Paunescu died Friday of multiple organ failure aged 67, and the nation immediately went into mourning for the larger-than-life poet. One newspaper devoted its entire Saturday edition to him.

Former Premier Adrian Nastase called for a day of mourning, but President Traian Basescu said he admired Paunescu’s poetry but not his left-wing politics.

About 2,000 people gathered at Bucharest’s Atheneum Sunday where he has been laid in state. They shouted his name and threw white flowers on his coffin. He will be buried with military honors, next to 19th-century poet Mihai Eminescu.

Originally Published: November 7, 2010 at 6:11 a.m.

BUCHAREST, Romania — Thousands of Romanians have gathered for the funeral of poet Adrian Paunescu whose poetry struck a chord despite odes he wrote to late Communist dictator Nicolae Ceausescu.

Paunescu died Friday of multiple organ failure aged 67, and the nation immediately went into mourning for the larger-than-life poet. One newspaper devoted its entire Saturday edition to him.

Former Premier Adrian Nastase called for a day of mourning, but President Traian Basescu said he admired Paunescu’s poetry but not his left-wing politics.

About 2,000 people gathered at Bucharest’s Atheneum Sunday where he has been laid in state. They shouted his name and threw white flowers on his coffin. He will be buried with military honors, next to 19th-century poet Mihai Eminescu.

Originally Published: November 7, 2010 at 6:11 a.m.
